intro: Paepalanthus capitatus, commonly known as the Andean buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and rosette-like arrangement of its basal leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Andean mountains. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
